author: m.kalinin
content:
What is the "same mempool"? The mempool that we currently have will not go offline and will be active since the first PoS block in the system. The Merge is swapping PoW with the new PoS consensus, it doesn't directly affect existing mempool, and the transition designed in a way that there will be no downtime on the Mainnet. So, once TTD is reached by the mainnet, a beacon chain proposer will produce a block containing execution payload with transactions from the mempool.

What I have referred before is mev-boost (https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/) which will be activated an hour after the merge transition is finalized.

author: tersec
content: for a given number of active validators, the average number of validators per committee is (active validators)/(`SLOTS_PER_EPOCH` * https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/dev/specs/phase0/beacon-chain.md#get_committee_count_per_slot)

author: tersec
content: it aims to stay near `TARGET_COMMITTEE_SIZE` but it's not exact

author: tersec
content:
it's probably easiest to run
```python
    return max(uint64(1), min(
        MAX_COMMITTEES_PER_SLOT,
        uint64(len(get_active_validator_indices(state, epoch))) // SLOTS_PER_EPOCH // TARGET_COMMITTEE_SIZE,
    ))
```
or since one doesn't care about the actual indices, something like
```python
    return max(uint64(1), min(
        MAX_COMMITTEES_PER_SLOT,
        num_active_validators // SLOTS_PER_EPOCH // TARGET_COMMITTEE_SIZE,
    ))
```
for whatever numbers of active validators one is interested in

author: benjaminion
content: To expand on <@654267572107083777> 's answer, the current size of each committee size is either `N // 2048` or `1 + N // 2048` (where N is the number of active validators, and `//` is integer division). With 416987 validators that's either 203 or 204 in any given committee. For reference, I wrote about the full details here, https://eth2book.info/altair/part2/building_blocks/committees#the-number-of-committees.
